reasons_to_visit.details: Witness unique and lively traditional Carnival celebrations ('Brandons') in nearby towns like Moudon or Payerne, easily accessible from Lausanne, featuring parades, costumes, and local festivities (often early/mid-March).

Explore Lausanne's excellent museums (Olympic Museum, Plateforme 10, Art Brut) and attractions with significantly fewer crowds than peak season. Benefit from potentially lower accommodation prices (except possibly around Easter).

reasons_to_visit.reason: Ideal for Indoor Culture & Cozy Cafes
reasons_to_visit.details: Unpredictable weather makes March perfect for immersive visits to Lausanne's world-class museums, exploring art galleries, or enjoying coffee and pastries in cozy Old Town or Flon district cafes.

reasons_to_visit.reason: Early Signs of Spring in Lavaux & Parks
reasons_to_visit.details: Towards the end of the month, witness the first signs of spring with budding vines in the Lavaux UNESCO vineyards and early blooms (crocuses, daffodils) appearing in lakeside parks like Mon Repos or Ouchy.
Discover Europe's largest freshwater aquarium-vivarium, a fascinating indoor attraction perfect for a cool or rainy March day, showcasing aquatic ecosystems from around the globe.

Potentially catch the very end of the ski season with day trips to nearby lower-altitude resorts in the Vaud Alps (Leysin, Villars) or Jura mountains for skiing or snowshoeing, especially in early March.

reasons_to_reconsider.details: March is known for volatile weather in the region. Expect anything from bright sunshine to cold rain, strong winds ('bise'), grey skies, and even late wet snow, often changing rapidly.
Average highs are around 10-12°C (50-54°F), with nights near freezing. Lake Geneva can still produce morning fog, and dampness can make it feel colder, especially with wind.
While days lengthen considerably throughout March (approx. 11-13 hours daylight), they are still shorter than in summer, limiting outdoor exploration time.
Ski resorts are winding down; conditions vary greatly. Lower altitude hiking trails in Lavaux or Jura will likely be muddy and may have lingering snow patches.
If Easter falls in late March, Good Friday and Easter Monday are public holidays in Vaud with widespread shop closures and potential impact on services.
It's far too cold for swimming. CGN boat cruises operate on a reduced spring schedule, and watersport rentals are generally not yet available.

weather.precipitation: Highly variable. Mix of sunny spells, cloudy periods, rain showers, possibly sleet or wet snow. Lake fog possible. Often windy, especially the cold 'bise' wind.
weather.general_tips: Pack layers: thermal base, sweaters/fleeces, waterproof and windproof outer jacket, warm hat, gloves, scarf, waterproof footwear. Umbrella essential. Check weather daily.

tourism_level.crowds: Low season continues. Attractions like the Olympic Museum and Plateforme 10 are generally quiet.
tourism_level.pricing: Good value for accommodation typically available, representing shoulder season rates.
tourism_level.overall_atmosphere: Late winter/early spring transition. City is quiet. Focus remains on indoor activities, museums. Potential buzz from nearby Brandons carnivals if dates align.

events_holidays.name: Brandons de Moudon / Brandons de Payerne (Carnival)
events_holidays.date: Variable weekends, often early/mid-March (check specific dates)
events_holidays.description: Major traditional Vaudois carnivals in nearby towns (accessible by train). Feature large parades with floats ('chars'), Guggenmusik bands, costumes, confetti battles, and lively atmospheres.
events_holidays.notes: Check exact dates and train schedules. Moudon and Payerne offer distinct experiences. These are significant local events.

events_holidays.name: International Women's Day Events (Potential)
events_holidays.description: Look for special events, talks, or exhibitions related to International Women's Day.

unique_experiences.activity: Day Trip to a 'Brandons' Carnival (Moudon or Payerne)
unique_experiences.description: Experience an authentic Swiss carnival, quite different from German Fasnacht. Enjoy the parades, music, costumes, and festive (sometimes rowdy) atmosphere.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Check dates and parade times. Take the train. Dress warmly, maybe wear old clothes (confetti!). Be prepared for crowds and noise.
unique_experiences.best_time: Parade times on the main Carnival weekend

unique_experiences.description: Explore the history and spirit of the Olympic Games through interactive exhibits and artifacts. An excellent indoor activity for unpredictable March weather.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Allow 2-3 hours. Easily accessible via M2 Metro. Book tickets online if desired.

unique_experiences.description: Visit the MCBA (Fine Arts), Photo Elysée (Photography), and mudac (Design) museums, all housed in Lausanne's modern cultural hub.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Great way to spend a half or full day indoors. Check opening hours and potential combined tickets.

unique_experiences.where: Traditional restaurants (e.g., Pinte Besson, Café du Grütli)
unique_experiences.description: Warm up with a classic Swiss cheese dish in a cozy restaurant, perfect after exploring the city or returning from a chilly day trip.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Reservations recommended, especially for popular spots or weekends. Ask for local Vaudois wine pairings (like Chasselas).

weather.precipitation: Still highly variable ('giboulées'), but increasing chance of milder, sunnier days. Rain showers remain frequent. Snow in the city becomes unlikely.
weather.general_tips: Continue layering. Waterproofs still essential. Noticeably longer daylight hours encourage more outdoor time when weather permits. Check Easter dates.

tourism_level.crowds: Remains relatively low. Potential increase if Easter falls late in March, especially from local visitors.
tourism_level.pricing: Shoulder season value continues, but watch for price hikes around potential Easter dates.
tourism_level.overall_atmosphere: More noticeable signs of spring. Early flowers appear along the lake and in vineyards. City feels slightly more awake, especially on sunny days. Cafes might start putting out terrace seating (weather permitting).

events_holidays.name: Lausanne Marathon Registration Opens (Potential)
events_holidays.date: Often opens in Spring for the Autumn event
events_holidays.description: For running enthusiasts, registration for the popular October marathon might open.

events_holidays.name: Easter Weekend (Potential - Check Dates)
events_holidays.description: If Easter occurs, Good Friday & Easter Monday are public holidays. Expect chocolate bunnies and eggs in shops (Confiserie Nessi, Blondel), special pastries, and decorated fountains (sometimes).
events_holidays.notes: Widespread shop closures on Good Friday/Easter Monday. Check specific attraction hours. Book restaurants for Easter Sunday.

events_holidays.name: Early Spring Blooms in Parks & Lavaux
events_holidays.description: Depending on the year's weather, early spring flowers (daffodils, crocuses, magnolias) begin to appear in parks (Mon Repos, Jardin Botanique) and the first hints of green return to Lavaux vines.
events_holidays.notes: Enjoy the first splashes of color returning to the region.

unique_experiences.description: Explore this unique museum dedicated to 'outsider art', featuring fascinating works by self-taught artists. A thought-provoking indoor option.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Allow 1.5-2 hours. Check opening times. Accessible by bus from the city center.

unique_experiences.activity: Walk in the Lavaux Vineyards (Early Spring)
unique_experiences.description: Experience the UNESCO vineyards as they start to wake up. Trails might be muddy, but on a sunny day, the views over the lake are stunning, and crowds are minimal.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Wear sturdy, waterproof footwear. Check trail conditions. Bring layers as weather can change. Enjoy the quiet before the busy season.

unique_experiences.description: Discover aquatic life from five continents in Europe's largest freshwater aquarium. Interactive exhibits and impressive scenography.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Great indoor activity for families or rainy days. Allow 2-3 hours. Easily accessible via M2 Metro.

unique_experiences.activity: Wander Through Lausanne's Old Town (La Cité)
unique_experiences.where: Historic upper town around the Cathedral
unique_experiences.description: Explore the charming, steep cobblestone streets, discover small boutiques, visit Lausanne Cathedral, and enjoy views from the esplanade.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Wear comfortable shoes with good grip. Be prepared for hills. Enjoy the quieter atmosphere.
